title: Self-Regulated Learning Competency Enhancement Program Utilizing Achievement Emotions Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory and experience in primary education environments
context.additional_context: A systematic training process for pre-service teachers to develop strategies for regulating learners' emotions and motivation in virtual classroom environments

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more instructional strategies that evoke positive learning emotions applying the Achievement Goal Theory (AGT)
Learners practice self-regulated learning (SRL) phase-specific coaching techniques through VR simulations and can accurately complete self-regulation checklists with 80% or higher accuracy
Learners can establish and implement personalized activity plans for enhancing learning motivation based on formative assessment feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
